qas.question: Which contestant did the band Fuel ask to be their new lead singer?
Which season five contestant caused controversy with their performance of I Walk the Line?
Which contestant was surprisingly eliminated during the week of the top four?
Who performed a Fuel song on this season?
Fuel asked Chris Daughtry to become what?
Who was eliminated in the Top 4 show?
Which song performance did he receive both praise and criticism for?
Why did he receive criticism for I Walk the Line

answers.text: not crediting the arrangement to Live

context: <a0_0><a1_0><a2_0><a3_0><a5_0>Chris Daughtry<a5_0/><a3_0/><a2_0/><a1_0/><a0_0/>'s performance of Fuel's "Hemorrhage (In My Hands)" on the show was widely praised and led to an invitation to join the band as Fuel's new <a4_0>lead singer<a4_0/>, an invitation he declined. His performance of Live's version of "<a6_0>I Walk the Line<a6_0/>" was well received by the judges but later criticized in some quarters for <a7_0>not crediting the arrangement to Live<a7_0/>. He was eliminated at the top four in a shocking result.
